title: Thunderbird 128.10.1 ESR shows blank when opening .eml from NAS (128.5.2 ESR works fine)
content:
In Thunderbird 128.10.1 ESR, opening a .eml file directly from a NAS (SMB path) results in a blank message window. However, if I copy the same file to the local desktop and open it, the content displays correctly.

I tested Thunderbird 128.5.2 ESR, and it can open the same .eml file from NAS without any issue, so this seems to be a regression in 128.10.1.

I tried modifying the following config values with no effect:

security.sandbox.content.level = 0

security.fileuri.strict_origin_policy = false

Is this a new security restriction or a bug? Any workaround or fix available? Thanks!
creator: chan.ronny818

title: Problema al enviar correos desde nuevo ordenador – error SMTP
content:
Hola equipo de soporte de Thunderbird,

Me he cambiado recientemente de ordenador y he copiado la configuración de todas mis cuentas de correo en la aplicación Thunderbird. En el nuevo dispositivo, puedo recibir correos sin problemas, pero al intentar enviar un mensaje, recibo un error que indica que ha fallado la conexión al servidor de salida (SMTP).

El mensaje de error exacto es el siguiente:

“Falló el envío del mensaje. El mensaje no se ha podido enviar porque ha fallado la conexión al servidor de salida (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com. El servidor puede no estar disponible o está rechazando conexiones SMTP. Verifique que los ajustes de su servidor de salida (SMTP) son correctos y vuelva a intentarlo.”

He verificado que la configuración del servidor SMTP es la misma que en el ordenador anterior y he probado también con diferentes conexiones de red, pero el problema persiste.

Adjunto captura de pantalla del error para mayor claridad.

Agradecería su ayuda para resolver este inconveniente.

Gracias de antemano, Gemma
creator: gemmaespaciofemenino

title: Junk emails stay in Inbox until I look at that Inbox, then after I'm looking they're automatically marked and moved
content:
Everything was fine in 115esr. I think I missed 136 and upgraded to 137, and am now on 138. I have five IMAP accounts. The following behavior happens with all of them and has been occurring since I upgraded (to 137 and 138).

I open Thunderbird and it checks for mail. Inboxes will show new messages. I click on any of the Inboxes with new mail. The spam emails automatically get marked as junk and moved out of inbox, and that happens only after I view that Inbox.

The previous behavior, and what I expect to happen, is that the spam emails would get marked as junk and moved out of Inbox before I view that Inbox. It's odd to have an Inbox show new emails, go to look at the new emails, then watch them get marked as junk and disappear from Inbox. It's like schrodinger's inbox, the act of observing the inbox determines the fate of the spam emails :p
creator: faruukie

title: Caixa POP apontada na rede não exibe mais imagens
content:
Estou enfrentando um problema desde que atualizei o Thunderbird para a versão 138.0.1. Após essa atualização, o conteúdo das mensagens deixou de ser exibido. Os e-mails continuam sendo recebidos e enviados normalmente, porém, ao clicar ou abrir um e-mail, ele aparece com o conteúdo em branco.

Utilizo o protocolo POP em um servidor de arquivos. Quando migro a conta para armazenamento local, o conteúdo das mensagens volta a aparecer normalmente. No entanto, ao retornar a conta para o servidor de arquivos, o problema volta a ocorrer.

title: Typing after deleting removes space and joins two words together
content:
Hello,

Something strange has just recently started happening (I am on version 138.0.1, build ID 20250512083454).

When I delete a word e.g.

'My new record' changed to 'My new '

and then start typing again, Thunderbird removes the space I had left, after typing the first new letter, and joins the new word to the previous one like this

'My newr'.

I've tried updating and re-installing but that didn't help. I've tried a few different fonts but the problem remains. Is this a TB bug? I've never noticed this happening before. Is it a new setting that I need to tick or untick?

If anyone has any ideas, please let me know, it's driving me a bit mad.

Thanks!

title: Thunderbird for Android problems sending mail began several days ago.
content: Been using Thunderbird for Android for many months for the email accounts I have with my ISP [optonline.net]. Several days ago sending of emails began failing. Error messages appearing in my Android Notifications say, "Failed to send some messages" "Sender refused". This is happening on all 4 of the devices my wife and I use. 2 phones and 2 tablets. Optimum is blaming Thunderbird. Thunderbird is still working fine on my Windows computer. It seems that all info regarding turning on Troubleshoot mode is referring to the Windows version as I can't find the "Help" menu item in the Android version anywhere. I have reconfigured the accounts in Thunderbird multiple times. The setup of SMTP always seems to end clean with a message of "Settings saved". It seems to me that Thunderbird is getting some error code from my ISPs mail server and I am hoping to have some more info to share with their tech support. The version if Thunderbird for Mobile we are on now is 9. I noticed that version 9 was just released on 5/5/2025. Not sure when exactly version 9 was pulled down to my devices. My phone is Android version 10. My tablet is Android version 14. Both are having the same exact issue.
